poem:
**Meditations on Keanu**

The world darkens, a shadow 
  branded in my thoughts—
    not as myself, but the light 
  he carries. The screen flickers,
death waits patiently 
  by the stage door;
    we, frail aspirants, dream 
  of his serenity, his grace;
a rebirth distant, yet 
  nearer every breath taken.
